intro: Jussiaea virgata, commonly known as the slender water plantain, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Commelinaceae. It is native to wetland habitats in South America, particularly in regions with standing water or moist soil. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves that are often submerged or floating, and it produces small, inconspicuous white or greenish flowers. Jussiaea virgata is adapted to aquatic environments and plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems. Its presence is often indicative of healthy, undisturbed water bodies.
